greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of self-inverse permutations p on [n] where the minimal transposition distance equals k (k=0 for the identity permutation); triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: Columns k=0 and k=1 respectively give A000012 and A000085(n)-A170941(n).
Diagonal T(2n,n) gives A005493(n-1) for n>0.
link: Joerg Arndt and Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..30, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, k, s) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(n in s,
b(n-1, k, s minus {n}), b(n-1, k, s) +add(`if`(i in s, 0,
mathematica: b[n_, k_, s_List] := b[n, k, s] = If[n == 0, 1, If[MemberQ[s, n], b[n-1, k, s ~Complement~ {n}], b[n-1, k, s] + Sum[If[MemberQ[s, i], 0, b[n-1, k, s ~Union~ {i}]], {i, 1, n - k - 1}]]] ; T[n_, k_] := If[k == 0, 1, b[n, k-1, {}] - b[n, k, {}]]; Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 14}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 22 2015, after Maple *)
results.author: _Joerg Arndt_ and _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 11 2014
